result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurisha Marshay Hudson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Maintain full time school, employment or a combination of both.
No contact with Sports Authority, Carter's or Shanona D.
Court grants expunction if no new arrest rising to the level or probable cause occur and all fines are paid in full.
AODA assessment and complete any recommended treatment.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurisha Marshay Hudson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Court grants expunction if no new arrests rising to the level or probable cause occur and all fines are paid in full.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties and defense. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant sentenced to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence and concurrent to count 2. Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant sentenced to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence and concurrent to count 1. Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION FOR COUNTS 1 AND 2
-AODA assessment and complete any recommended treatment. 
-Maintain full time school, employment, or a combination of both.
-Complete 20 hours of community service. 
-No Contact with Sports Authority, Carter's, or Shanona D.
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges during the period of probation or upon revocation. Bail on deposit to apply. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

*Court grants expunction if no new arrests rising to the level or probable cause occur and all fines are paid in full. 

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Maurisha Marshay Hudson in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Maurisha M Hudson in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing at request of Defense. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Maurisha Marshay Hudson in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for projected guilty plea. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maurisha Marshay Hudson in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant has three pending misdemeanor cases. State requests a status conference date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Carter's/Osh Kosh B'Gosh located 11500 W. Burleigh Street, in the City of Wauwatosa, Milwaukee County, WI.

Defendant Maurisha Marshay Hudson in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Reserve, Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/28/15 @ 1:30pm
